textbooks.title: Machine Learning in Finance: From Theory to Practice

topics: Feed-forward neural networks with applications in finance
Convolutional neural networks with applications in finance

readings: Research papers; Examples: Clark et al. (2020): A machine learning efficient frontier
Golbayani et al. (2020): Application of deep neural networks to assess corporate credit rating

topics: Recurrent neural networks & long short-term memory (LSTM) networks with applications to financial time series
Special topics (ex: generative adversarial networks (GANs) or reinforcement learning for deep hedging)

grading.policies: This grading scheme is subject to change based on student outcomes. It may be curved more leniently. It will not be made more difficult.

assignments.description: 4 homework assignments and one large (individual) project during the semester.
Additional small assignments and quizzes will accompany certain lectures.

policies.late_work: No late assignments, without prior approval, will be accepted.
policies.academic_integrity: Copying solutions from other students in the class, former students, tutors, or any other source is strictly forbidden.
policies.accommodations: If requested, virtual office hours via Zoom can be arranged.

additional_info.course_format: The lectures will combine lectures, guest presentations, class presentations, and discussions.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Students will be expected to install and have Python running on their computers.
additional_info.support_resources: Questions about course material can also be asked by email or in the Discussion Section of Canvas.

_metadata.course_description: This course is designed for Master and Ph.D. graduate students and advanced undergraduates. The purpose is to learn to apply machine learning techniques to financial problems.
learning_outcomes: Be able to apply neural networks to financial problems
Be able to evaluate the performance of different methods to determine the best method/hyperparameters
Learn how to interpret results of machine learning in a financial context
Create and apply neural network models for regression and classification tasks in finance
Evaluate performance of trained machine learning models
Understand applicability of diverse techniques in deep learning
